The Oldest Story Ever Written: Why I Find It So Difficult To Get To The Gym

The Oldest Story Ever Written: Why I Find It So Difficult To Get To The Gym

A three-letter word with which we have a love-hate relationship: GYM.

Yes, we should take care of our bodies. Yes, we should be fit. Yes, going to the gym makes you happy but jaye kaun? It requires a lot of determination, courage, guts, money, self-love and a lot of heavy adjectives to go to the gym. And I have none.

I am sure there are many people like me and these are the thoughts we regularly have. Read ahead.

1. I can't get up in the morning and I am too tired in the evening. When do I go to the gym?

Tenor

2. Kaha se laun fancy gym ke liye paise?

Tenor

3. Why should I pay to hurt my body? Excuse me!

Tenor

4. I can't wash my hair every day. Sorry!

Tenor

5. I don't think there is a good crowd in that gym.

Tenor

6. I don't want a muscular body. Natural is my thing.

Tenor

7. Sports wear is way too expensive, I can't afford it.

Tenor

8. I don't have nice headphones. I can't work out without having one.

tenor

9. I walk everyday while commuting from office to work. That is my gym.

Tenor

10. Can I get fit by sleeping, please?

Tenor

11. I'll instantly gain more weight if I quit the gym, no?

Tenor

It requires a lot of determination, courage, guts, money, love for body and a lot of heavy adjectives to go to the gym. And I have none.
